Interestingly enough, I remember that the spot where the cannons appear is the place where the original had the small doors that opened to reveal the retro thrusters. You should create a pair of retro thrusters in the style of XanderTek's Landertrons using BD's animation plugin for auto deployment. Just need to create a little cutout in the front of the wing near the hull for them to fit into.

Also, to be true to the orbiter original, you need to add the retractable radiators.

A little setback and not hard to do. On another note RCS thrusters (although not placed correctly on wing surface) worked great

Wings are done everything worked out great. Going to tweak the airlock as far as Eva's. Oh and I need to fix the radiator. Switching to radiator module caused animation s to not play. Going to add the extendable ladder at nosecone

well I got the cockpit with 130 groups and 12 different textures with multiple meshes down to 1 mesh and 1 texture. All done in unity I might add. Not in 3d modeling software. So point being is the cockpit no longer lags the game. And transitioning from SPH to launch pad is very smooth and loads quickly

Redneck - this looks great!

Honestly, I was never as big a fan of XR-1. I'm all about the Ravenstar though. I'm desperate to fly the XR-2 as my second shuttle program. (I do alt-histories with my programs and I really need an SSTO to replace the KSO when the time comes. 

As far as which skin to go with - you're gonna get a million suggestions so mine won't bother you too much, hopefully.

I'd go with this one [http://www.orbithangar.com/addonpics/XR2Boeing.png](http://www.orbithangar.com/addonpics/XR2Boeing.png) and dump the Boeing lettering. Maybe replace it with an ALTEA or leave it as a flag setup. Then again, it's tough to go wrong with white, gray, or black.

If there's any way I can help with this, let me know. I'm learning Unity and I'm not bad with coding. I'd love to give you a hand if I can. 

Awesome work so far. 

My advice - don't go crazy with the controls and IVA. From past experience, it's easier just to complicate a mod that works than it is to make a complicated mod.

If I get to launch components for a long-range space cruiser with an XR-2 with my own flag and name on the side of it - that would literally be the realization of what I've dreamed of since I started playing KSP.
